metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27365 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3. Certain iSCSIdata structures do not have appropriate length constraints or checks, andcan exceed the PAGE_SIZE value. An unprivileged user can send a Netlinkmessage that is associated with iSCSI, and has a length up to the maximumlength of a Netlink message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-139-generic - 4.15.0-139.143
linux-image-4.15.0-139-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-139.143
linux-image-4.15.0-139-lowlatency - 4.15.0-139.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-139-generic - 4.15.0-139.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-139-lowlatency - 4.15.0-139.143
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-72-generic - 5.3.0-72.68

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-139.143').
